snippet: Prime Minister Antonis Samaras said he hoped to raise 2.3 billion euros (about $3 billion) from a tax increase on middle- to high-income earners, self-employed professionals and businesses.
abstract: Greek lawmakers vote to increase taxes on middle- to high-income earners, self employed professionals and businesses despite strong objections by political opposition and several ruling coalition deputies who insist austerity-weary citizens should not be subjected to further pain.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Antonis Samaras said he hoped to raise 2.3 billion euros (about $3 billion) from a tax increase on middle- to high-income earners, self-employed professionals and businesses.

headline.main: Greece Votes to Raise Tax on Higher Earners
headline.print_headline: Greece Votes to Raise Tax On Its Higher Earners
